traits.office: Roman prefect governing Judea under the emperor.
traits.portrayal: reluctant but pressured judge who yields to the crowd and orders crucifixion.
traits.responsibility_for_jesus: authorizes execution while attempting to distance himself from blame.

traits.portrayal: hesitant judge who receives a warning dream through his wife and symbolically washes his hands.
traits.responsibility_for_jesus: declares innocence but releases Barabbas and hands Jesus over to be crucified.

traits.office: Roman governor hearing charges against Jesus.
traits.portrayal: repeatedly declares Jesus innocent and tries to release him, sending him to Herod as well.
traits.responsibility_for_jesus: ultimately concedes to the crowd's demand for crucifixion.

traits.office: Roman governor engaged in a political and theological dialogue with Jesus.
traits.portrayal: vacillating ruler who questions Jesus about kingship and truth but fears the crowd and the charge of disloyalty to Caesar.
traits.responsibility_for_jesus: has authority to release or crucify and ultimately delivers Jesus to be executed.

traits.office: Roman ruler mentioned in apostolic preaching as participant in Jesus' condemnation.
traits.portrayal: figure in salvation history aligned with other rulers opposing God's holy servant.
traits.responsibility_for_jesus: named among those who condemned and killed Jesus, though details are not narrated again.
